name: Hotel Plaza Mayor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: This hotel boasts both a great price and a great location on the edge of the plaza mayor! The staff are helpful and friendly and assisted us with booking tours and general advice.
reviews.title: A Great find!
Top Location
reviews.text: While the hotel itself is lovely with good views from the front rooms, myself and two others stayed in the hotel's apartment just around the corner as the rooms were booked out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The apartment was perfect, nicely decorated, lovely and clean with marble lined bathroom. It has one double room and a comfy sofa bed in the living area. Ther is also a nice pool at the rear of the complex.
reviews.title: Very nice central hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend both the hotel and the apartment for your stay in Madrid! The price is fantastic and oh did I say the staff were lovely already!!
reviews.title: Great value, perfect position

likes.disliked: — Building carries noise from other guests very easily.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in early September 2008. This is a good hotel. It is very well located a few steps away from Plaza Mayor and plenty of restaurants and shopping. Our room was an internal one with a small window looking out into an internal patio area. The room was small but clean with an excellent shower. Since we didn't spend much time in our room it was fine, but if you are looking for luxury, look elsewhere. We paid extra for breakfast and it was fairly standard fare, but nice. Staff were friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: madrid gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located right next to Plaza Mayor and is a few minutes walk to SOL metro station. The room is pretty basic but the bathroom was above average with very good water pressure. The staffs here were very good, they will go out of their way to explain you directions and other queries that you may have. If you are looking for place to crash at night and will be spending your day exploring madrid and I would recommend this place. It is great for the price. I paid Euro 85 per night for double room excluding tax and breakfast thru hotel web. Look no further.
reviews.title: Good Location

likes.disliked: — very small tv with limited english channels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Plaza Mayor. It got off on a rocky start, but I think that was mostly because we were exhausted from traveling, it was the end of our trip, and it was late. I had confirmed repeatedly that we wanted a corner room on an upper floor (bc of the reviews talking about noise on lower floors) When we arrived, we had a corner room, but it was the first floor (one up from the street) I complained and was told they could do nothing. I asked for a price adjustment and was refused. Not even a free breakfast was thrown in...that was a little frustrating.
reviews.title: superb location

likes.liked: — location, comfy beds and great shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were offered the suite on the top floor, but would have had to pay the full price for it (even though it wasn't rented to anyone else).
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: But, once I got passed my initial frustration, we really enjoyed the hotel. The bathroom is HUGE, not just by European standards. The shower was a big walk-in with amazing hot water and pressure. The bed was the most comfortable off all the beds we had in Europe. The room was clean and modern with wonderful views out to the Plaza. Yes you hear street noise and middle of the night partiers...but I took earplugs and slept great through it all.
reviews.title: Central, clean hotel with helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: One of the best things about this hotel is it's location. The train from the airport to hotel is easy, and hotel is only a few short blocks from the train stop. And you are literally IN the heart of the Plaza and amazing surrounding area...so you step out the front door of the hotel and just start walking. It's also on the same block as Medina Mayrit, which is a great experience.
reviews.title: Very nice small hotel Centrally situated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of the hotel could not have been better. The hotel is small but clean, the shower had great water pressure, and the staff were friendly. Exactly what you want in a hotel that you aren't going to be spending much time in anyway. Do not expect a hairdryer, but the TV did have CNN in English.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights with another couple. The location of this hotel is the best. We could see Plaza Mayor from our window. The desk staff was more than helpful. We ate breakfast in the lobby two of the mornings. They had a very good selection for a little over 7 Euros. We also played cards in the breakfast area a few times, which was nice. Many of the hotels don't have tables for this. We upgraded to a superior room, which was not that expensive. I didn't think the room was that large until I saw a door open to another room. After seeing how tiny the room was, I realized we had made a good decision. The rooms were very modern. The bathrooms were awesome. They looked as if they had just been remodeled. We used the internet in the lobby for a minimal charge, which was very convenient. I would definitely recommend this hotel if staying in Madrid.
reviews.title: Great location and great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plaza mayor was a great hotel to stay at.We couldnt have pick a better place. It was very clean and the staff was super friendly. The location was the best part. In walking distance of everything.If you want to eat good food and save some money take a 5 minute walk to sol and there are alot of restaurants to choose from that are so good and so cheap. Thought the restaurants in plaza mayor were a little more money. I would recommend hotel plaza mayor to everyone. Cant beat the price.
reviews.title: excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have now been back in Denmark for almost 5 hours and I just NEED to write this review.
reviews.title: Perfect!
Definitely to recommend
reviews.text: I have lived in Spain and been to Madrid 3 times before. Once at Hostal Lisboa (in 1993 when I was a bit younger ;-), once at Hotel Cortiz (that is now closed as the building is under reconstruction) and once at a hotel Iberia paid for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just had 2 nights at the plaza mayor and it delivered in every way. I had room 201 which though small was clean and comfortable, nice bright bathroom, tv, wardrobe and safe. My friends were on the fifth floor though and said that their rooms werent as good. Location is brilliant, so close to everything. We got a taxi from the airport which cost €35 which i though was a bit steep - if you have time take the metro as it only costs €2 per person and is very easy. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great value, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had planned our trip to Spain for the past year and the consensus opinion amongst all of the guidebooks I regularly use (Rick Steves, Frommer's and Lonely Planet) about where to stay in Madrid was the Hotel Plaza Mayor so I never really considered any other place. I have to say that they were all right on the money. We stayed in Madrid for four nights and could tell right off the bat that our stay was going to be enjoyable. The location couldn't be beat - a stone's throw from the Plaza and a five minute walk from the Puerta del Sol. And although it was so centrally located the outside noise from the street was not too bad at all and keep in mind that our first night there was the start of the San Isidro Festival! The room size was fairly large by my knowledge of European standards and the bathroom was also of a good size. We ate breakfast at the hotel each morning and it was excellent - a selection of hams and sausages as well as bread and fruit, etc. Everyone at the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful and did their best to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. And the kicker is - the rates (even factoring in the lousy dollar/euro exchange rate) were extremely reasonable. To sum up, I would wholeheartedly recommend the Hotel Plaza Mayor to anyone visiting Madrid.
reviews.title: As good as promised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These people will bend over backwards to help you with whatever you need. Service is their strength. The room was secure, clean, and fairly comfortable (beds not plush). We were satisfied with our stay and would book again.
reviews.title: Service is their Strength...I'd stay again.

likes.disliked: — The shower is a bit small...I'm an average size person so it wasnt an issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good location - close to plaza and within walking distance of cathedral, palace & botanical gardens. Friendly staff. No bar, no tea/coffee facilities in room - only vending machine in foyer. Not suitable for elderly or infirm with luggage as lift starts on the first floor
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel based on reviews on here and because it was the only budget hotel in the top 10.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — Location, nice decent sized room (and clean !)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, it has been "discovered". We stayed here in the fall of 2005. It was still relatively unknown, although it had already made its way into Rick Steve's guide. We stayed 4 nights and found it to be exceptional in all regards. Normally, you get what you pay for, but in this case, I think you get a lot more. The rooms (particularly the upper floors) were large enough to spread out...the bathrooms were large enough that you didn't feel cramped. We had a great view overlooking the gate to the Plaza Mayor and the plazas across the street. The breakfasts were good...and most importantly, the staff was helpful...even in a little emergency (we needed a dentist), they were helpful in getting us an appointment. I can't say enough, except that since they have become so popular, you better make reservations long in advance if you want to stay here.
reviews.title: Greatr Value, great location, great staff

likes.liked: — Apart from the very helpful staff, the location sold us

reviews.title: Good value for the money
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel in a great location for the money! it's right in the middle of all the sights with lots of good eating and tapas bars nearby.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's taken me some time to write this review, so forgive me. My husband and I stayed here in October 2006.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION and PRICE. Can't be beat. You walk out your door and you are in the Plaza Mayor. Taxis are always available right outside of the hotel if needed, but you are centrally located to most everything.
reviews.title: Great location and value though request room on upper floors
Great price, great location
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Plaza Mayor for 2 nights in May 2007. Paid 60 Euros per night for a single room. It wasn't luxurious, but for the price it was well worth it. Location was perfect, room was quiet (could hear hallway noise but no noise from other rooms or from outside), bed reasonably comfortable, reception staff was really friendly, and had a good view out my window. Plenty of hot water. Internet access available in lobby at a reasonable cost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had only a few minor complaints - no hair dryer in room (but they did have 2 available at the reception desk to borrow for a short period of time), and there was only one towel in the bathroom (besides the hand towel). Would have liked 2 - one for hair, one for body.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location

likes.liked: — Location and View from my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't take advantage of the breakfast, but it looked like it offered a good variety when I walked by (for 7 Euros I think).
reviews.title: Great Location, clean and reasonable
Well Worth Staying
reviews.text: In all, a good budget-friendly hotel in Madrid. Would stay here again, but would pack a hair dryer next time! (In case the hotel is reading this, it would still be a bargain at 5 Euros more per night with a hair dryer. Just a thought....)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during our trip to Spain last May. Could not have made a better choice. The hotel is very clean and the location is excellent. You can walk to all the important places in less than 10 minutes. The subway station is also very close. The "Plaza Mayor" and "Plaza del Sol" are a few blocks away. We asked for a room in the top floor with a balcony and a view to the street, could not have asked for more. It was just great. Make sure you ask for this when you make your reservation, the extra bucks are worth it. Our friends got a very small room with no view and a very small shower. The front desk people moved them the next day to a much better room. The buffet breakfast was nice and not that pricey (7.50 euros) compared to other hotels we stayed at. I loved this hotel, it was definitelly one of the best we had. If you are looking for a 2 star hotel (felt more like a 3 star), don't look for anything else because the "Hotel Plaza Mayor" is the way to go you
reviews.title: A very nice hotel, GREAT location!

likes.disliked: — nothing, it was a great experience

reviews.title: Excellent value and location-Get the Palomar suite
reviews.text: The location was great. The staff were friendly (with one minor exception). We had the Palomar suite (Room 600) awesome suite, great balcony with private roof top view and beautiful sunsets. Really unique and special room, for the price it was incredible. The elevator goes to the fifth floor, this is on the sixth, so you should know you have to walk a short flight of stair. Well worth it. I would see the need to stay anywhere else even if money was no object.

reviews.title: great location, great value
reviews.text: David

reviews.title: Nasty staff
reviews.text: We thought this hotel was a great value and definitely in the best location. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were especially nice. The staff was always helpful with questions and restaurant reservations. We ate breakfast only one morning at the hotel, but thought it was a decent value as well. It was quiet and nice to be so centrally located and near Plaza Mayor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Old hotel, but convenient and quiet location in Madrid -- we walked to everything. We stayed in an interior room (room 107), which was depressing for 4 nights--recommend upgrading to have a view outside (rather than door that opened to air shaft). So nice to have breakfast available in hotel lobby when we needed a quick start in morning.
reviews.title: Convenient but modest accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just what you need to enjoy more time in Madrid. The location is perfect. About a 10 block walk from the Atocha rail station. (uphill to hotel...but downhill leaving). Right next to bus stop.
reviews.title: Great Location - Great Price

likes.disliked: — Air Conditioning took a tad long to kick in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1 block from Plaza Mayor and two blocks from Plaza del Sol and Metro Sol...you can't get any better than that. Yet the price was absolutely inexpensive relative to the great location. Less than 100 Euros a night for a double. The rooms were clean. The hotel staff was nice and helpful. The breakfast was filling, including hot foods and cheaper than the Corner Cafe across the way. If you're looking for luxury, look elsewhere. If you're looking for a great deal...you've found it at Plaza Mayor.
reviews.title: Perfect for Us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a great hotel for the price!!!! Location was perfect. Right near the Sol subway station. We could see Plaza Mayor from our room. We stayed in the Room directly over the flags. Second floor. Nice king bed. Great bathrom and shower. Not a lot of noise for being next to a street. Lots of things to do nearby. Staff was very helpful. This is a great find for us from searching the internet. We weren't expecting much but wow were we suprised when we arrived! Perfect place! Highly recommended. Very clean. Visit the nearby Museo De Hamon where tons of ham hocks are hanging on the walls and beer is great. Stop by the Plaza and eat free samples of cheese and taste the local wines.
reviews.title: So close, So nice..a Madrid must

likes.disliked: — No elevator to our room -3rd floor but it worked out ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: Do you like original art on the wall? Do you like a staff that seems more honest than corporate (they are not owned by any major chain). We spent five wonderful days in June. The price was great, the staff wonderful. We opted out of the breakfast which was extra--more fun to find something good on the streets--great pastries to be found not far. . The hotel is less than a block from Plaza Mayor--we walked down to the Palace and the park. Hotel is ideally located ( I know I sound like an ad I am not)It is an ideal location--we felt very safe. Rooms were fine. Try to get a streetside location you can look down to see some wonderful sights.
reviews.title: Lively location and clean, comfortable rooms

likes.disliked: — Larger room and hairdryer would be nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small, modest, clean hotel, very well located near the Plaza Mayor , for under 100 euros per night. Nothing fancy but all the basics are there and the rooms were very clean. We had a "deluxe" double for 95 euros. The only downside was that our room was in the front and a little noisy but not enough to be a real problem. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is quite good at 7.50 euros.
reviews.title: Good Value in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fabulous spot this was. Smack bang in the middle of old Madrid. We were able to walk to most of the sights we wanted to see and the main shopping area was a short stroll as well. Close to the main square in Madrid, we arrived on the eve of Good Friday and were treated to a wonderful Easter procession through the Plaza Mayor. The following day, another started right under our window. The colour, noise and spectacle was fabulous.
reviews.title: In the of Old Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was spacious and the bathroom well equipped. We were on the first floor and heard some of the street noise (always take your earplugs with you!), however our friends were on the second floor and heard nothing.
reviews.title: Little Gem!

reviews.text: There was a lift, however we still needed to carry our luggage up some stairs. There were nice little sitting areas to meet with our friends for a drink. The cafe and bar were only open for breakfast, which was good value. The staff were friendly and hellpful and spoke good english.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is awesome, great price for what it offers. My single room is clean and of a decent size. It even has a full-size bed (rather than small twin bed I'm used to in single rooms). Bathroom is modern but shower stall only. It has high ceiling which makes the room feels more spacious.
reviews.title: fab location
Ideal Location and Great Value
reviews.text: A small, apparently family-owned hotel located just a few steps from Plaza Mayor. Ideally located for all major attractions in Madrid. The staff are very friendly and helpful, even loaning us a Nokia phone charger and checking the location of a restaurant that another Tripadvisor traveller had recommended.

reviews.title: Nice staff, good value, great location
reviews.text: We booked directly with the hotel, through its website, having seen a recommendation in the Saturday Travel section of The Daily Telegraph in July 2008. Initially, we requested a corner room (as others had suggested) at 95 Euros per night, but enquired about the suite. The hotel replied within 12 hours, confirming its availability. At 120 Euros, we thought it very good value, considering its size (basically, in the hotel attic/loft) and facilities (a super outside terrace - 6 floor up and with views over the Madrid rooftops!). The only slight downsides were a bed that began to feel a little hard after 4 nights (it is a firm mattress onto a solid divan) and some small amount of noise that permeated the roof (although these were police sirens, and so very loud). You also need to lug bags up the final short flight of steps from the 5th floor, as the lift stops there, so it's worth remembering for those who may struggle. My wife was not so impressed with the lack of a mirror in the room, although there is one with ample lighting in the bathroom. The TV has a variety of European channels, plus CNN and Eurosport. There was also (what appeared to be) a DVD player, though we didn't use it.

reviews.title: Great Locationand Great Value
reviews.text: We visited at an exceptionally hot time (late 30s Celsius), but the room AirCon worked well and the curtains and roof blinds (for the 3 Velux windows) kept out the heat and light. Others have criticised the bathroom for 'only' having one sink! However, we found this to be ample, as it is large and square. The shower could easily accommodate two people, and whilst it didn't seem to drain especially well during use, it never overflowed. Water pressure was fine and supplies of soap and towels plentiful. The room was always kept very clean and laundry changed regularly. Decor is pleasant - stylist, yet subtle. The impression was one of a staff who took pride in the hotel, as there were even pot plants on the terrace.

reviews.title: Ideal place to stay
reviews.text: Overall, a great room and a lovely small hotel. We would not have changed it.

reviews.title: A Quintiessential Small European Hotel
reviews.text: We took breakfast on the first morning. At 7.50 Euros per person, it is fine if you're hungry/thirsty, as you can help yourselves to the usual selection of fruit, juice, coffee, cheese, bread, croissants, etc. We tried other places for breakfast, too. These were cheaper, but only because you pay per item. For example, juice, coffee and a slice of toast at the cafe diagonally across the small square in front of the hotel cost us around 5 Euros each. As an alternative, we bought some fruit, juice, etc. and breakfasted on the terrace, before grabbing a coffee later.

description: Our Hotel opened its doors in 1997, in 2007 the hotel was reformed and extended its rooms until the present 33 rooms and our Palomar Suite.We offer all the advantages of careful and personal. Our personnel will serve as aid offering you all the information that you need during your visit, person to person.We are an excellent election for the independent traveller who’s looking to discover the traditional flavour of Madrid in a different and calm way.
